articles.author: Andrew Macaskill, Elizabeth Piper, Alistair Smout
articles.description: Keir Starmer will be Britain's next prime minister with his Labour Party set to win a massive majority in a parliamentary election, an exit poll on Thursday indicated, while Rishi Sunak's Conservatives are forecast to suffer historic losses.
articles.title: UK's Labour on course for massive election majority, exit poll shows

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iranians will vote in a run-off presidential election on Friday amid voter apathy and heightened regional tensions.
articles.title: Iranians vote in run-off presidential election amid widespread apathy

articles.author: Jessie Pang
articles.description: Prominent Hong Kong activist Joshua Wong should be considered an active participant in a landmark subversion case involving 47 democrats, his lawyer said on Friday, but urged a court to hand him a lighter sentence for entering his plea early.
articles.title: Hong Kong court hears mitigation pleas from Joshua Wong, other democrats

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan on Friday reported renewed Chinese military activity nearby with another "combat patrol" as the government called on Beijing not to escalate tensions after the seizure of a Taiwanese fishing boat.
articles.title: Taiwan reports more Chinese military activity, calls for de-escalation

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will convene his security cabinet on Thursday evening to discuss new Hamas positions on a ceasefire deal in Gaza, a source in Netanyahu's office said, as fighting in the enclave raged.
articles.title: Israel weighs Hamas response to Gaza ceasefire proposal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas made a pretty significant adjustment in its position over a potential hostage release deal with Israel, a senior U.S. administration official said on Thursday, expressing hope that it would lead to a pact that would be a step to a permanent ceasefire.
articles.title: US sees 'breakthrough' in Israel-Hamas talks, senior official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Peru's Congress passed a law on Thursday introducing a statute of limitations for crimes against humanity, despite opposition from human rights organizations who argue the measure will hamper ongoing investigations into serious abuses.
articles.title: Peru Congress approves statute of limitations for crimes against humanity

articles.author: Yuddy Budiman
articles.description: Indonesian conservationist Nyoman Sugiarto has been working for 16 years to preserve coral on the reefs of Bali, but the frequency of mass coral bleachings he says is now devastating.
articles.title: Coral bleachings devastate Bali reefs as sea temperatures rise

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's far-right National Rally (RN) party will likely fall short of an absolute majority in forthcoming parliamentary elections, OpinionWay said in a poll for business daily Les Echos published on Friday.
articles.title: National Rally to fall short of absolute majority in French parliamentary elections, poll shows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States welcomed a two-week humanitarian truce in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), the White House said on Thursday, amid fierce fighting between government troops and Rwanda-backed M23 rebels.
articles.title: US welcomes humanitarian truce in Congo, White House says
